answers.answer: no it does not mean you will get pre eclampsia.  there are no symptoms.  I failed for 2 pg's .  first one I controlled it with diet adjustments.  SEcond one I had to take insulin shots.  third one didn't have it.  It is not a big deal and is easily controlled.  Don't worry

HI,I had it with my 1st pg and I didn't even need to follow a strict diet, although I was very careful what I ate and I had to take my blood 2 hours after each meal.  I also had to have fetal non stress tests every 2 weeks, but that meant I got a lovely sonogram of her growing in my tummy and I didn't mind that either.My DD was born healthy and I am fine.

Thanks ladies! I am a worry wart :/  I failed with a 144. I have read horror stories about the 3 hr adn Im petrified! Scared I maight throw it back up or something. The 1 hr didnt bother me at all. Well thanks again! I appreciate it!

you might not have failed at all if you had not eaten!!!!!!!!!! so make sure you do not eat this time! anyway, i failed the 1 hour in both pregnancies, and passed the 3 hour.  i don't know what horror stories there could possibly be, because other than having to sit there for 3 hours bored and hungry, there is nothing to be afraid of.

Pre eclampsia is more linked to high blood pressure and protein spilling in to the urine.   I don't think the GD puts you at risk for that.     However, for what it's worth...I had preeclampsia with my last pregnancy.  I think it showed up at about 7 1/2 months...i was put on "at home" bed rest and the worst effect I had from it was that I got very swollen in my hands and feet.   The did have to incude me at 38 weeks because of it, but everything turned out fine.   The big scary one is eclampsia.   I wouldn't worry too much about this.

Thanks everyone! Yea that piece of toast might of messed up my results. I ate it 5 min before drinking the glucose drink :/  The stuff Ive read is that alot of people throw it back up b/c its so sweet :(  I hope that doesnt happen as I only wanna do it one time :0  Thanks again!

question: does it necessarily (sp?) mean you will get pre-eclampsia? I have to go back Monday for the 3 hr test adn Im scared if I fail it I will get PE :0   Did anyone who had GD have any symptoms of it? Thanks!
title: If you get GD diabetes during pregnancy....
